StopList.description: A comma-separated list of words, a named list or a URL to a plain text list, one word per line. By default this is set to 'auto' which auto-detects the document's language and loads an appropriate list (if available for that language). Set this to blank to not use the default stopList. For more information see the Stopwords documentation.

Query.description: A query or array of queries (queries can be separated by a comma). For query syntax, see the search documentation.

DocId.description: The document ID(s) to restrict the results to.

DocIndex.description: The document index(es) to restrict the results to.

Categories.description: The categories ID to use. For more information see the Categories documentation.

Bins.description: The number of "bins" to divide the result into.

Start.description: The index of the item to start the results at.

Limit.description: The number of items to limit the result to.

Context.description: The number of terms to consider on each side of the keyword.

WithDistributions.description: Determines whether to show "raw" or "relative" frequencies (those are the two valid values).The default value is "relative" (unless there's only one document in the corpus, in which case raw frequencies are shown).

TermColors.description: Which term colors to show in the grid.By default this is set to 'categories' which shows the term color only if it's been assigned by a category.The other alternatives are 'terms' which shows all terms colors, and '' or undefined which shows no term colors.

Columns.description: One or more column data indexes to display, separated by a comma.Use this to modify the default set of visible columns.

SortColumn.description: The column to sort the results by

SortDir.description: The direction in which to sort the results: 'asc' or 'desc'

bins.description: The number of "bins" to divide the result into.

For more information see the Stopwords documentation.

whiteList.description: a list of words to always include

limit.description: Specify the number of terms to load (which is separate from the number of {@link Cirrus.visible} terms to show) at a time).

visible.description: Specify the number of terms that are visible at a time.

docId.description: The document ID(s) to restrict the results to.

docIndex.description: The document index(es) to restrict the results to.

inlineData.description: Directly specify the terms and their relative sizes.There data format is a comma-separated list of colon-separated term/size pairs.For example: love:20,like:15,dear:10,child:6

fontFamily.description: The CSS font-family to use for the terms

stopList.description: A comma-separated list of words, a named list or a URL to a plain text list, one word per line. By default this is set to 'auto' which auto-detects the document's language and loads an appropriate list (if available for that language). Set this to blank to not use the default stopList. query.description: A query or array of queries (queries can be separated by a comma). For query syntax, see the search documentation.

maxBins.description: The maximum number of bins to use for distributions in Trend.By default this is set to 100 (in other words, if there are more than 100 documents in the corpus, they will be forced into 100 bins).Higher values are possible but it can cause performance issues and necessitate more data transfer (values for each one of the bins for each one of the terms).

termColors.description: Which term colors to show in the grid.By default this is set to 'categories' which shows the term color only if it's been assigned by a category.The other alternatives are 'terms' which shows all terms colors, and '' or undefined which shows no term colors.

comparisonCorpus.description: An existing corpus to be used for comparison purposes.None of the columns visible by default use comparisonCorpus so this is an advanced parameter used when the "Comparison" column is shown.The comparison column shows the relative frequency of the term in the corpus compared to the relative frequency of the same term in a comparison corpus.

minInDocumentsCountRatio.description: The minimum coverage (as a percentage) for terms. For instance, if a corpus has 10 documents and the minimum coverage is 20%, at least two of the documents must contain the term or it will be ignored.

overlapFilter.description: Specifies the strategory for prioritizing and filtering out phrases. Options are: 'none' (no filtering), 'length' (prioritize phrase length), or 'rawFreq' (prioritize phrase frequency). See Phrases options for more info.
